屼字的基本解释

屼
wù
山光秃：“（山）嵬嶷嶢屼。”
高耸：“有石峰屼立。”

屼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wù］
［《廣韻》五忽切，入没，疑。］
亦作“1”。
(1)秃山。
(2)山高耸貌。参见“屼屼”、“屼嵲”、“嵲屼”。
(3)见“峍屼”。
(4)见“屼”。

屼字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【山字部】　屼； 康熙笔画：6； 页码：页307第22
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?五忽切。音兀。?屼，山貌也。一曰禿山貌。【唐元結系樂府】山屹屼兮水淪漣。　又五屼，山名，在犍爲郡。一山有五重，故名。【左思·蜀都賦】躡五屼之?嵼。

bare hill
Basic explanation of words
bare hill
wù
The mountain is bare: "(Mountain) Weiyi嶷峣屼."
Towering: "There is a Shifeng standing."
bare hill
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wù］
["Guangyun" five sudden cuts, no, doubtful. ]
Also known as "1".
(1) Bald Mountain.
(2) The mountains are towering. See "屼屼", "屼嵲", "嵲屼".
(3) See "峍屼".
(4) See "屼".
bare hill
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Collection] [Mountain Character Department] 　屼; Kangxi Strokes: 6; Page Number: Page 307 22
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Five sudden cuts. Yinwu.屼, the appearance of the mountain is also. One is the appearance of Bald Mountain. [Tang Yuan knots Yuefu] The mountain is Yiqi and the water is falling.　Five more, the name of the mountain, in Qianwei County. A mountain has five layers, hence its name. [Zuo Si·Shu Du Fu] Qiao Wuqizhi? Mei.
bare hill
